intro: Jasione, commonly known as the "blessed thorn," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Caryophyllaceae. These plants are native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, often found in grasslands and rocky soils. Jasione species are characterized by their showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in early summer. They typically have slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and many are used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The genus includes around 30 species, some of which are cultivated for ornamental purposes.
